text:
as far as I understand, tomcat.sh env is ment to be run like
===
#!/bin/sh
. tomcat.sh env
===
but one ocasanally might run 
. tomcat.sh in his current shell in order to get
the CLASSPATH set by tomcat.sh
and if he occasinally doesn't have $TOMCAT_HOME set
his current shell exits
creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org

text:
I don't think we can fix it - it's just a convenience method to set your
classpath, you can use your own script ( that includes only what you need ).
The only "fix" would be to completely remove the "env" option, and that'll
probably be done in a later version ( since starting tomcat can now be done
with java -jar , there is almost no need for shell scripts )
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
